title: Limit Notifications for Health Monitoring
task: Schedules regular video check-ins with Olivia to assess her health
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to ensure that I am not disturbed by non-critical notifications during my busy work hours, so that I can concentrate fully on my patients and deliver the best care without distractions.

title: Wearable Sensor Trust Establishment
task: Explains the benefits of using wearable sensors for health monitoring
summary: As a medical staff member, I want my patients to trust the wearable sensors so that I can focus on providing efficient care without their concerns about privacy affecting our interactions.

title: Control Over Health Data Sharing
task: Respects Olivia's privacy concerns by discussing data sharing options
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to have the ability to access only the health data I need for my patients, so that I can focus on providing efficient and respectful care during my busy shifts without being distracted by unnecessary information.

title: Limit Notifications for Caregiver Alerts
task: Configures ALFRED to limit notifications according to Olivia's preferences
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to receive only the alerts that are critical to my patient care, so I can concentrate on my responsibilities without unnecessary distractions during my busy shifts.

title: Limit Notifications for Health Monitoring
task: Monitors Olivia's vital signs through the ALFRED system remotely
summary: As a busy registered nurse, I want to focus solely on the critical health alerts that directly impact my patients, so I can provide the best care possible without distractions from unnecessary notifications.

title: Control Over Health Notifications
task: Offers reassurance to Olivia about the non-intrusiveness of the system
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to receive only the critical health notifications from ALFRED during my busy shifts, so that I can concentrate fully on my patientsâ€™ needs and provide the best care without any distractions.

title: Control Over Health Data Access
task: Encourages Olivia to view ALFRED as a supportive tool for her health
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to access patient health data quickly during my shifts so that I can provide timely and effective care to my patients without unnecessary delays, prioritizing their immediate needs in a busy healthcare environment.

title: Streamlined Health Data Access
task: Explores the health data integration tools on ALFRED after his shift
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to quickly access patient health data without waiting for permissions, so I can give my patients the immediate care they need during my busy shifts.

title: Streamlined Access to Patient Data
task: Feels frustrated by the inefficiency of accessing patient data
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to quickly access patient health data without waiting for permissions, so I can provide the best care possible during my busy shifts without unnecessary delays.

title: Streamlined Access to Patient Data
task: Sends feedback about the need for more intuitive access to patient data
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to access patient health data quickly and efficiently, even if I have to bypass explicit permission, so that I can ensure my patients receive timely care without the interruptions that can arise from waiting for consent.

title: Quick Access to Patient Data Without Permissions
task: Expresses annoyance at needing explicit permissions to access patient data
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to access patient health data quickly and efficiently, even if explicit permissions are not granted, so that I can provide timely support to my patients during my busy shifts without unnecessary delays that could affect their care.

title: Streamlined Access to Patient Data
task: Struggles to balance patient care with the limitations of the current system
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to quickly access my patients' health metrics without needing to wait for their explicit permission, so I can efficiently provide care during my busy shifts and minimize distractions.

title: Monitor Cognitive Engagement
task: Accesses Elena's health data through ALFRED to monitor her cognitive engagement
summary: As a medical staff member, I want to ensure that Elena receives the cognitive stimulation she needs, so I can quickly access her health data through ALFRED and make personalized suggestions that fit her preferences without overwhelming her.

title: Monitor Engagement in Cognitive Games
task: Expresses professional concern about Elena's lack of game engagement
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to be informed if my patient is not engaging with cognitive games, so I can directly address their mental health needs and ensure they receive the support necessary for their well-being.

title: Cognitive Game Engagement Support
task: Suggests cognitive games as a method to support Elena's mental health
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to engage my patients in cognitive games that suit their individual needs, so I can effectively support their mental health while managing my time efficiently.

title: Respect User Autonomy in Activity Suggestions
task: Offers alternative activities to respect Elena's autonomy
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to respect my patients' preferences by suggesting alternative activities when they decline cognitive games, so that I can support their engagement in a way that feels comfortable and aligns with their autonomy.

title: Respect Patient Autonomy in Engagement
task: Maintains a professional tone while addressing Elena's needs
summary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient engagement data without any suggestions from ALFRED, so I can ensure that my patients' choices for cognitive health support are fully respected and prioritized.
